mapper.sql: id, user_id, login_id, usertype_old, operate_id_old, usertype_new, operate_id_new, create_time, update_time
mapper.insert:
insert into sys_user_history
id,
user_id,
login_id,
usertype_old,
operate_id_old,
usertype_new,
operate_id_new,
create_time,
update_time,

mapper.update:
update sys_user_history
user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
login_id = #{loginId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
usertype_old = #{usertypeOld,jdbcType=INTEGER},
operate_id_old = #{operateIdOld,jdbcType=INTEGER},
usertype_new = #{usertypeNew,jdbcType=INTEGER},
operate_id_new = #{operateIdNew,jdbcType=INTEGER},
create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update sys_user_history set user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, login_id = #{loginId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, usertype_old = #{usertypeOld,jdbcType=INTEGER}, operate_id_old = #{operateIdOld,jdbcType=INTEGER}, usertype_new = #{usertypeNew,jdbcType=INTEGER}, operate_id_new = #{operateIdNew,jdbcType=INTEGER}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select:
select count(a.id) from sys_user_history a LEFT JOIN sys_user_execute b ON a.user_id = b.id LEFT JOIN sys_user c ON a.login_id = c.id LEFT JOIN sys_user d ON a.operate_id_old = d.id LEFT JOIN sys_user e ON a.operate_id_new = e.id where 1=1
and a.user_id=#{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER}
